info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued December 13 at 7:15PM MST until December 15 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Dangerous to Extremely Dangerous fire weather conditions on Wednesday... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 013...014...027...028...029...041...042...253 AND 254... * Affected Area...In Colorado...Fire Weather Zone 253 Kit Carson and Fire Weather Zone 254 Cheyenne. In Kansas...Fire Weather Zone 013 Sherman...Fire Weather Zone 014 Thomas...Fire Weather Zone 027 Wallace...Fire Weather Zone 028 Logan...Fire Weather Zone 029 Gove...Fire Weather Zone 041 Greeley and Fire Weather Zone 042 Wichita. * Winds...Southwest 35 to 45 mph with gusts up to 70 mph in the mid morning to very early afternoon hours, shifting to the west and northwest with gusts up to 60 mph from mid afternoon through sunset as a cold front moves through. * Relative Humidity...As low as 17 percent. * Impacts...Any fires that start will have extreme fire behavior and spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not advised. Any fires that do develop will quickly become out of control. First responders will need to be mindful of the timing of the expected abrupt wind shift when fighting any fires. Blowing dust is also expected and visibilities could be very low. First responders may be impacted.
info.instruction: Outdoor burning is strongly discouraged Wednesday. The National Weather Service in Goodland strongly encourages dispatch offices to notify us of any fires as soon as possible so we can provide immediate decision support.
